answers.answer: Thank you for responding.  We brought him back to the hospital last night. He is becoming swollen. He had kidney issues for many years and high blood pressure as well. He had not had dialysis yet although I suspect that he will in the very near future. In 24 hours he had less than 250 cc's of urine output. Never had diabetes.

question: Seven days ago my 85 y/o father was admitted to the ICU for Neurontin toxicity.  He doctor prescribed it for nerve pain from shingles without any regard for existing kidney disease.  Kidney ultrasound showed that his right kidney is very small and not functioning.  His left kidney has 11% functionality.  Creatinine is 4.6 and on multiple meds to maintain his blood pressure.  In these seven days he went from Stage 4 to Stage 5.  I hate to ask, but what can we expect now?Thank you
title: Stage 5 CKD
